BWPanda said:

I just launched my first ecommerce site in Backdrop: https://nannyjo.anderson.mx/

Very nice

@BWPanda you want suggestions or you want to let it ride for a bit? There's only two issues I see on the product pages, one is a glaring issue and the other suggestion probably won't make a big difference one way or the other.

@Phil Ward Let me have it :smile: But also don't be upset if I ignore them (it's a freebie site for my Mum's hobby, and she also has certain ideas about how she wants it to look/work). So while I know there are ways it can be improved, some things are likely to just stay as they are for now...

They aren't crazy changes @BWPanda so you don't have to worry about hard criticism :wink:. Just tricks of the trade I've learned over the years.

1) move the add-to-cart right below the price. Conversions are higher when the add-to-cart is up high and within or very close to above the fold.

2) this will be a bit more difficult, but see if you can figure out a way to move the product title above the images for mobile.

Its fine where it is on desktop (to the right and above the price) and it would be fine on mobile if there were 4-5 thumbnail images but the 15-20 images on mobile shove the title below the images so it creates a "what am I looking at?" moment.

Thanks @Phil Ward. I actually had the same thought about moving the cart button higher, but when I tried I couldn't as the content of the page is one block, so I can't (currently) insert the cart block in the middle..
@BWPanda I wondered about that... So it's not like UC or Commerce where the button is its own block. That's interesting.

The button is its own block, but everything else on the page is the 'main content' block. So currently the button has to be either above or below everything else. I'll have to redo the layout to add individual field blocks instead...
Thanks again @Phil Ward, I've just implemented both of your suggestions.
It was easier than I thought - I just added the price field as a block to the layout, and removed it from the content type display mode, then arranged the blocks in the layout accordingly.
@BWPanda looks beautiful :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
